Container.Name: Collabora
Container.Overview:
Collabora Office Documents collaboration software server.[br] Meant to be used with NextCloud and OwnCloud.[br]
[span style=\'color: #E80000;\']Docker run Example:[br] [/span] $ docker run -t -d -p 127.0.0.1:9980:9980 -e "domain=your.dot.escaped.domain" \ -e "username=admin" -e "password=S3cRet" --restart always collabora/code[br][br] [span style=\'color: #B820E5;\'] DONT_GEN_SSL_CERT[/span][br]When this environment variable is set (is not “”), then startup script will not generate a new SSL certificate signed by a dummy CA. It is useful, if you want to use your own SSL certificate for some reason.[br] [span style=\'color: #B820E5;\'] cert_domain[/span][br] When this environment variable is set (is not “”), then startup script will generate a new SSL certificate signed by a dummy CA for this domain, not for localhost.[br] [span style=\'color: #B820E5;\'] server_name[/span][br] When this environment variable is set (is not “”), then its value will be used as server name in /etc/loolwsd/loolwsd.xml. Without this, CODE is not delivering a correct host for the websocket connection in case of a proxy in front of it.[br] [span style=\'color: #B820E5;\'] dictionaries[/span][br]By default only limited set of spelling dictionaries and thesauri are configured for CODE, mainly for performance reasons. The default set of languages is the following: [span style=\'color: #C68A13;\']de_DE en_GB en_US es_ES fr_FR it nl pt_BR pt_PT ru[/span]. With the dictionaries environment variable you can change this list. The dictionaries environment variable should contain the space separated list of language codes (optionally followed by country code). In order to save resources, it makes sense to load only those dictionaries that are actually needed.[br] [span style=\'color: #B820E5;\'] extra_params[/span][br]You can pass extra loolwsd command line parameter via this environment variable. For example, if you want to start loolwsd without SSL, when you test or develop, the syntax is: -e "extra_params=--o:ssl.enable=false". To learn about all possible options, refer to the self-documented /etc/loolwsd/loolwsd.xml configuration file in the Docker image.
